alert.note: Alert for Capitol Reef National Park and Vicinity; South Central Utah; Southern Mountains; Western Canyonlands (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 3:45PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Garfield County through 415 PM MDT... At 344 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles east of Boulder, or 20 miles northeast of Escalante, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Garfield County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Capitol Reef National Park and Vicinity; South Central Utah; Southern Mountains; Western Canyonlands
